condition.description:
Cirrhosis is scarring of the liver. Scar tissue forms because of injury or long-term disease. Scar tissue cannot do what healthy liver tissue does - make protein, help fight infections, clean the blood, help digest food and store energy. Cirrhosis can lead to

  • Easy bruising or bleeding, or nosebleeds
  • Swelling of the abdomen or legs
  • Extra sensitivity to medicines
  • High blood pressure in the vein entering the liver
  • Enlarged veins called varices in the esophagus and stomach. Varices can bleed suddenly.
  • Kidney failure
  • Jaundice
  • Severe itching
  • Gallstones

A small number of people with cirrhosis get liver cancer.

Your doctor will diagnose cirrhosis with blood tests, imaging tests, or a biopsy.

Cirrhosis has many causes. In the United States, the most common causes are chronic alcoholism and hepatitis. Nothing will make the scar tissue disappear, but treating the cause can keep it from getting worse. If too much scar tissue forms, you may need to consider a liver transplant.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Cirrhosis

carousel_items: Makes you urinate more often, so don't take it at bedtime.
Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how it affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked one week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun, so use proper protections.

basics.benefits_moa: Aldactazide is a combination medicine that lowers your blood pressure with two diuretics (water pills), hydrochlorothiazide and spironolactone. They act on different parts of your kidney to get rid of extra fluids.
basics.bottom_line: Aldactazide removes excess fluid in your body and lowers your blood pressure, while helping keep your potassium levels safe.
downsides: Many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs blood tests to monitor electrolytes and kidney function.
Can make you urinate more often.
Can make you sensitive to sunlight.
Shouldn't take it if you have a sulfa allergy.

downsides_processed.orig: Many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs blood tests to monitor electrolytes and kidney function.
Can make you urinate more often.
Can make you sensitive to sunlight.
Shouldn't take it if you have a sulfa allergy.

upsides: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
Gets rid of extra fluids in your body.
Helpful for people who tend to have low potassium levels.

drugs.name: Aldactazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Makes you urinate more often, so don't take it at bedtime.
Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how it affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked one week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun, so use proper protections.

risks_warnings.title: Tumor development
risks_warnings.description: Use of Aldactazide in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, and should only be used for FDA approved indications.

description_processed.orig: Use of Aldactazide in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, and should only be used for FDA approved indications.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle problems due to electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide can affect levels of certain electrolytes (sodium, magnesium) that can cause muscle weakness/spasms or unexplained tiredness. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your electrolytes and kidney function.

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide can affect levels of certain electrolytes (sodium, magnesium) that can cause muscle weakness/spasms or unexplained tiredness. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your electrolytes and kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with hydrochlorothiazide in Aldactazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with hydrochlorothiazide in Aldactazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Breast pain or swelling
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine.

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine.

Can take 2 to 3 days to see full diuretic effects and 2 to 3 weeks to see blood pressure lowering effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Spironolactone is a potassium-sparing diuretic that blocks aldosterone (a hormone) and helps the kidney get rid of excess fluids in your body.
basics.bottom_line: Spironolactone is helpful when added to another diuretic to get rid of excess fluid in your body. Doesn't work well on its own.
downsides: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.
Has many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs to have blood tests done to monitor electrolyte levels and kidney function.

downsides_processed.orig: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.
Has many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs to have blood tests done to monitor electrolyte levels and kidney function.

upsides: Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
More useful when taken with another diuretic that'll also help your body get rid of extra fluids.
Reduces the risk of death in people with heart failure.

Caused enlarged breasts, and sore nipples, as well as high glucose levels. scary stuff
I wish I had started at a higher dose from the start. 25mg did nothing, now months later, I'm on 100mg and it's much more effective.
might make you feel tired like beta blockers.

carousel_items: Take it with food.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and erectile dysfunction.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

clock.tip: Take with food to lower the chance of getting head rush.

basics.benefits_moa: Carvedilol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Carvedilol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
For people with severe heart failure, Carvedilol lowers the risk of worsening heart failure, hospitalization, and sudden death.

Can cause dizziness in the first few days.

risks_warnings.title: Worsened chest pain; increased risk of heart attack and heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart failure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

description_processed.orig: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who have overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who have overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

carousel_items: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting. Headache can be a sign that the medicine is working.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make you really dizzy.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Isosorbide mononitrate is a nitrate. It dilates blood vessels all over the body. This makes it less work for the heart to pump, which relieves heart-related chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Isosorbide mononitrate is good for chest pain, but you have to be able to stick to your dosing schedule or it won't work as well.
downsides: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

downsides_processed.orig: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

upsides: Prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) from the narrowing of heart blood vessels (coronary artery disease).

upsides_processed.orig: Prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) from the narrowing of heart blood vessels (coronary artery disease).

userStories.identifier: busy at work and after work exercise 5 d
userStories.tip: Some head ache at first but ajusted to it

drugs.name: Imdur

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting. Headache can be a sign that the medicine is working.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make you really dizzy.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Don't use Isosorbide mononitrate with an erectile dysfunction medicine without talking to your doctor. You can feel dizzy or fall from a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If you continue to feel dizzy or have episodes of fast heart rate a week after using Isosorbide mononitrate, dose adjustment or a different medication may be needed.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of erectile dysfunction medicine

description_processed.orig: Don't use Isosorbide mononitrate with an erectile dysfunction medicine without talking to your doctor. You can feel dizzy or fall from a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If you continue to feel dizzy or have episodes of fast heart rate a week after using Isosorbide mononitrate, dose adjustment or a different medication may be needed.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance
risks_warnings.description: Your body can get used to Isosorbide mononitrate and the same amount of medicine no longer works as well as it used to, also known as tolerance. This type of tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. The likelihood of tolerance can be lowered if there is enough time in between the doses. Take this medicine as instructed.

This type of tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. The likelihood of tolerance can be lowered if there is enough time in between the doses. Take this medicine as instructed.

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

userStories.tip: Nausea, dizziness and loss of energy.
I actually take it for essential tremor. It works very well. My hands no longer shake which is great.
The worst side effects for me...threw me into a deep depression. Horrendous.
I take it for occasional stage fright.

I've used it for public speaking, it works great totally stops irrriating hand or voice shakes. However; I experienced sudden dizziness after getting up quickly after a period of long period of sitting.
took this to manage shakes from lithium. it worked pretty well.

no issue; take as low of a dose as possible, remember to not skip doses, and prepare for a day when you don't need to take it any longer. completely stopped my anxiety from lasting more than a couple of minutes.
I started taking it for migraine prevention, but then found it completely rid me of my stage fright and issues with public speaking.
I'm taking very short amounts for anxiety since my doctor wants me to calm down but doesn't want to give me any drug that would mess up with my brain. It's working great!
Take it only when you need. It reduces the physical symptoms of anxiety, such as sweating, but it does not help with the mental aspect of anxiety

carousel_items: Take with food to lessen upset stomach.
Can cause dizziness, headache, diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting.
Avoid taking aluminum-containing antacids since it doesn't let Urso work as well.
It can take several months before the gallstone is completely dissolved.

basics.benefits_moa: Urso helps dissolve gallstones by lowering the amount of cholesterol your body makes and absorbs. Lower cholesterol prevents gallstones from getting bigger and allows your body to get rid of the gallstone over time.
basics.bottom_line: Urso is a decent way to get rid of gallstones if surgery isn't an option for you.
downsides: Can take long time for gallstones to be fully dissolved.
May not work depending on the initial size of the gallstone.
Often causes upset stomach.
Can be pricey.

downsides_processed.orig: Can take long time for gallstones to be fully dissolved.
May not work depending on the initial size of the gallstone.
Often causes upset stomach.
Can be pricey.

upsides: Helps dissolve gallbladder stones without needing to have surgery.

upsides_processed.orig: Helps dissolve gallbladder stones without needing to have surgery.

userStories.tip: I am chronic ulcerative colitis patient with sclerosis cholangitis (for 25 years). Have taken the Urso for years with no side effects. This med along with reduced alcohol use has brought my liver values back to new normal.

drugs.name: Urso

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to lessen upset stomach.
Can cause dizziness, headache, diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting.
Avoid taking aluminum-containing antacids since it doesn't let Urso work as well.
It can take several months before the gallstone is completely dissolved.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Bile acid sequestering agents (like Cholestyramine and Colestipol) and aluminum-based antacids can interfere with how well Urso works by not letting it be absorbed by your body. Estrogens, oral contraceptives, and clofibrate (and perhaps other lipid-lowering drugs) can cause gallstones to be made and work against the effectiveness of Urso.

description_processed.orig: Bile acid sequestering agents (like Cholestyramine and Colestipol) and aluminum-based antacids can interfere with how well Urso works by not letting it be absorbed by your body. Estrogens, oral contraceptives, and clofibrate (and perhaps other lipid-lowering drugs) can cause gallstones to be made and work against the effectiveness of Urso.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Although it seems unlikely, the possibility that Urso can cause fetal harm cannot be ruled out. Therefore, the drug is not recommended for use during pregnancy.

description_processed.orig: Although it seems unlikely, the possibility that Urso can cause fetal harm cannot be ruled out. Therefore, the drug is not recommended for use during pregnancy.
